communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

According to public reporting, Coplink X has been beta tested by departments in Kansas City, New Orleans, Massachusetts and Oregon. I'm looking for documents pertaining to the department's usage the COPLINK or COPLINKX software from January 1, 2018 until the date this request is processed.

1. Invoices or receipts for the purchase of any the COPLINK or COPLINK X product/service
2. Communications, internal memos or directives that mention Coplink, Face Match, or FaceMatch
3. MOU's or Information Sharing Agreements about COPLINK or COPLINK X
4. Brochures or product/service specifications about COPLINK.
5. Privacy policies, manuals, briefings mentioning COPLINK or COPLINK X

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Case File 281A-NY-245-269
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The complete case file starting with the identifier 281A-NY-245-269 and all derivative material in the file. All contents of this file are of interest, and should be returned regardless of form number, format or serialization.

Upon information and belief, this file concerns an investigation and prosecution from approximately 1996 to 1998 (both years approximate and inclusive). Subjects of the investigation included members of the Genovese family of Cosa Nostra, leadership of law enforcement unions, and several vendors to the unions. 

Records should be released in the public interest which outweighs the privacy concerns. Additionally, there is no forseeable harm in release of the file, as the matters contained within are over 25 years old and either adjudicated or beyond the statute of limitations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee
